data.title: As a user, I should be able to control visibility and order of views
data.body:
As a user, I should be able to do following in Explorer / Debug and Extensions views
- toggle views visibility. Right click on the section title to hide. Right click on the view title to show/hide section.
- re-order the sections by drag and drop

data.title: tsx files highlighting is bugged
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|bracket-pair-colorizer|CoenraadS|0.10.7|
|autoimport|steoates|1.2.2|;


---
Syntax coloring is very inconsistent throughout the file.
Looks like something in constructor breaks coloring.
if and for statements are colored as if they are function declarations.
But even if I comment out constructor, it breaks later.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Clone repository https://github.com/Xecutor/azinc
2. Open GameRoot.tsx file, methods right after constructor are colored strangely.
3. Look at [screenshot](https://yadi.sk/i/2BWXHwEY3Km2qT).

data.title: ERRORLEVEL not works in batch file tasks
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (cea00a71bef01a5ecbae39a8dd4f1bd08fd50c57, 2017-07-03T11:15:12.102Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16215


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have `build.bat` file
```cmd
call tsc -p .
IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 (
    echo OK
) else (
    echo TSC failed
    exit 1
)
```
2. Create task for this file
```json
       ...
         {
            "taskName": "runBuildScript",
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "problemMatcher": "$tsc",
            "windows": {
                "command": "build.bat",
                "isShellCommand": true
            }
        }
     ...
```
3. Create simple TypeScript project and make a typo (or anything that causes error in `tsc`)
4. Run Task `runBuildScript`

Expected Result: `TSC failed` because `tsc` exited with code `2`
```
src/cogs/guilds.ts(1158,28): error TS2304: Cannot find name 'CMD_GUILD0S_MEMBERS'.
TSC failed
```
Actual Result: Task completed without errors:
```
src/cogs/guilds.ts(1158,28): error TS2304: Cannot find name 'CMD_GUILD0S_MEMBERS'.
OK
```

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Wrap default `Enter` behavior in a command
data.body:
My situation is, I need to add more functionality to <kbd>Enter</kbd> key.
For example, using `|` to indicate the cursor, `==>` means pressing Enter
```
- item|       - item       - item
         ==>  - |     ==>  
                           |
```
I find it hard to implement with `onEnterRules`. So I override the default <kbd>Enter</kbd> behavior by adding a shortcut <kbd>Enter</kbd>.
But then the default indentation rules won't work any more unless I re-implement them...

As a comparison, I also override <kbd>Tab</kbd> and <kbd>Backspace</kbd> keys. The difference is, when I have no custom behavior to perform, I can just call `commands.executeCommand('tab');` and `commands.executeCommand('deleteLeft');`

data.title: [code assist] let the user choose whether to overwrite the following word or only insert.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Win 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. When I start typing a tag right before text that already exists, it will bring up the suggestions and when I select the tag that I want (whether by pressing "Enter", "Tab", or by selecting it with the cursor), then the word next to it is overwritten by the tag. 

It does this with any suggested tag as far as I can tell.

I have attached 3 pictures where I am trying to add the emphasis tag to the word "website". The first picture is before I have started to tag, the 2nd is as I start to type the tag (you will notice that the word "website" is being highlighted in blue), and then after I have selected the emphasis tag from the suggestions you can see the word "website" is gone and replaced with just the tag.

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11046720/27844107-25e544e6-60da-11e7-917a-561e90f731ae.PNG)

![capture1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11046720/27844123-6e190f86-60da-11e7-88b2-f3d9c257a8c4.PNG)

![capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11046720/27844124-75a35f86-60da-11e7-8378-2e4b1fdae7f7.PNG)


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes (I think, I am new to vsc and programming in general, so I think that I hadn't added any extensions to begin with. Someone else suggested the extension htmltagwrap, but that was the first extension I installed and it was doing it before. With that wrapper installed, I would highlight the text I wanted to tag and when I typed "<" it would add angled brackets to the beginning and end, but as soon as I typed anything else then it would overwrite the highlighted portion.

data.title: Queue data during pty launch delay Fixes: #29184
Launcher/debugger breaks something in Electron web worker (with node enviroment)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download [this](https://github.com/FrogTheFrog/electron-quick-start.git) repository.
2. Run `npm install` in working directory.
3. Run `npm run start`.
4. Open developer tools via menu or `Ctrl+Shift+I`.
5. Confirm that there are no errors and close Electron app.
6. Launch Electron app via debugger ("Electron Main").
7. Open developer tools via menu or `Ctrl+Shift+I`.
8. Get `Uncaught Error: Cannot find module` error.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Here's how everything looks in action:

![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22381748/27841250-703d7ab2-6108-11e7-9cb0-c4449892a880.gif)

**Edit:**
Sorry about that sad face in the gif. I spent about an hour narrowing this issue to vscode, so I was just somehow emotional, I guess.

data.title: Move search panel to the bottom
data.body:
Or at least make it configurable.

Maybe it's because I'm coming from Atom, but I feel like I need more horizontal space in search results.

data.title: Console output referencing root directory files don't get ctrl+click link
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

Assuming you have an already working TypeScript project.
1. Create a faulty typescript file "file.ts" containing garbage in the root directory of your project
2. Run tsc -p in the same directory.

Actual Result:
You'll get some console logs like
```
37     faulty code
          ~~~~~~~~
file.ts(37,18): error XXXX: YYYY
```
The problem resides that normally you'd be getting a relative path (e.g. to the file causing the error), but that's not the case if the file is located in the root directory.

1. Create a PHP file
2. Add a block (some text inside { and } 
3. Before the close bracket "}" add a coment like this: // comment
4. Press Ctrl + S (to save)
5. A blank line is added before the close bracket "}" each time "Ctrl + S" is pressed.

data.title: ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED when VSCode launched from shell
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|theme-base16-ocean|golf1052|1.0.1|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.62|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.16|;


---

When launching VSCode from shell (in this case WSL on Windows 10), when waking the computer from sleep on a new network, the following error is displayed in the shell that launched VSCode (even though the shell had moved onto other commands since launch):

```
{ exception: Error: net::ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED,
  error: null,
  promise:
   { _creator: null,
     _nextState: null,
     _state:
      { name: 'error',
        enter: [Function: enter],
        cancel: [Function: s],
        done: null,
        then: null,
        _completed: [Function: s],
        _error: [Function: s],
        _notify: [Function: m],
        _progress: [Function: s],
        _setCompleteValue: [Function: s],
        _setErrorValue: [Function: s] },
     _listeners: null,
     _value: Error: net::ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED,
     _isException: true,
     _errorId: 6,
     done: [Function: done],
     then: [Function: then] },
  handler: undefined,
  id: 6,
  parent: undefined }
Error: net::ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED
[uncaught exception in main]: Error: net::ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED

Error: net::ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED
Error: net::ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED

Error: net::ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED
    at Timeout._onTimeout (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main
.js:4:44676)
    at ontimeout (timers.js:365:14)
    at tryOnTimeout (timers.js:237:5)
    at Timer.listOnTimeout (timers.js:207:5)
```
Please note that VSCode is still running after the error is emitted, and does not seem to be impacted by it.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VSCode using `code .` in a directory from WSL (possibly other shells/envs too)
2. Put computer to sleep
3. Move to a different wireless network

data.title: Implement context menu actions in CompositePart
data.body:
This will enable context menu actions in `CompositePart`. This is needed to manage visibility of views in side bars similar to that in activity bar.

data.title: Task spinner should only run for build tasks with a problem matcher when using 2.0.0
data.body: Otherwise we show a spinner close to the problem status indication without detecting any problems.

data.title: The less extension should contribute problem matchers for common less and sass compilers

We should move the one defined in core out.

/cc @aeschli @egamma
